Job Location: Lagos

Role overview

	This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, enjoys solving ambiguous problems, and is motivated by impact.
	You will play a key role in driving alignment across teams by supporting OKR tracking, leading quarterly business reviews, improving our Notion-based operating system, and providing analytical insights to support decision-making.
	This is a high-impact role with direct exposure to leadership and critical business decisions.

	Support company-wide OKRs, helping teams define objectives, track progress, and stay focused on strategic goals.

	Identify and drive continuous improvement, optimising processes and introducing efficiencies across teams.

Requirements


	2 - 3 years of experience in consulting, strategy, business operations, or fast-paced startup environments.

	Tech-savvy mindset with solid proficiency in tools like Notion, Google Sheets/Slides, and a proactive approach to adopting new tools.
	Analytical thinking with the ability to translate data into clear recommendations.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with confidence engaging senior stakeholders.
	Self-starter attitude, comfortable taking ownership and driving outcomes independently.

title: Job Vacancies at Schneider Electric
content:
Schneider Electric - As the Global Specialist in Energy Management™ and market leader in industrial automation and software, Schneider Electric enables people to experience and transform efficiency where they live and work; from home to enterprise, across the grid and the city. Focused on making energy safe, reliable, efficient, productive and green, the Group brings a world where innovative individuals use collaborative solutions to make the most of their energy, while using less of the common planet.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Project Manager - Process Automation

Req ID: 95390
Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Description


	An exciting opportunity has arisen within our Process Automation business unit for a  Project Manager to join our delivery team in sub-Saharan Africa and be based in Nigeria.
	The successful candidate will be fully accountable for delivering and managing high-value, strategically essential customer projects throughout the region.
	These projects will cover various industry sectors, including oil and gas, pharmaceutical, power, nuclear, food and beverage, water and utilities, automotive and energy.


What will you do?


	All project management activities, including project planning, risk management, financial control, and reporting.
	Acting as primary contact with our customers on all aspects of project delivery.
	Communication with project stakeholders at all levels within the customer and Schneider Electric organisations.
	Project team leadership, including coordination of engineering, production, test, product development, purchasing and quality assurance activities.
	Management of sub-suppliers and subcontractors involved in the execution of the projects.
	Ensure consistency in project execution according to Customer Project Process (CPP) and PMI standards.
	Determine and manage the required resources for the project or programme.
	Line management responsibilities for any project managers assigned.
	Coaching and mentoring less experienced employees.
	Adherence to project governance and cadence policies. This includes updating internal reporting tools and preparing and presenting project status at any internal review.
	Negotiating and executing contract variations with the customer in accordance with company policies and standards.
	Resolution of any contractual issues with support from contract management experts.
	Developing partnerships with key customers and third parties.
	Travel for customer meetings both within the country and abroad as required by the assigned projects. Most international interactions are virtual.


What skills and capabilities will make you successful?


	We are looking for an experienced senior project management professional with proven success in delivering large-scale digital solutions to external customers.
	The successful candidate will have strong leadership, interpersonal and communication skills, motivation, and determination to succeed in a fast-paced and highly innovative environment.
	The ideal candidate should be able to demonstrate experience and expertise in ERP systems e.g SAP.
	Knowledge of process automation business is advantageous.
	Excellent command of the English language, both verbal and written.
	Knowledge of structured project management methodologies such as Prince 2 or PMbok from PMI.
	Can demonstrate flexibility and resilience in a challenging and fast-moving environment.
	Proven ability to strategically deliver the best results in a digitally transforming environment with agility.


What qualifications will make you successful for this role?


	Educated at degree level with a minimum of 6 years, typically 8 years of project management experience.
	Minimum B.Sc./ B.Eng. degree in any relevant discipline, e.g. Electrical & Electronics, Control Engineering, or Computer Science.
	Vast experience in a system, software, process automation or application engineering capacity with industry knowledge and experience.
	Knowledge of managing and reporting on all financial aspects of assigned projects.
	Able to negotiate contract variations for engineering changes with customers.
	Familiarity with general contractual terms and conditions.
	Conversant with MS Project and all MS Office software products, Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint etc.
	Proven ability to work in a complex environment and collaborate across multiple business functions to achieve common business objectives.
	Must possess a project management qualification, e.g. Prince 2 qualification or PMP certification.
	Ability to understand, influence & convince in a complex and agile matrix organisation.
	The position requires residency in Nigeria & profeciency in English.


Who will you report to?


	This role reports directly to the Delivery Manager, Process Automation, English Speaking Africa. 
	As part of the regional Process Automation team, the role operates within a dynamic, cross-functional environment, collaborating closely with stakeholders across business units, including operations, IT, and digital transformation teams.
	The position is designed as an individual contributor role, with a strong emphasis on ownership, initiative, and collaboration.
	While it does not have direct reports, the role requires leadership in driving automation initiatives, influencing stakeholders, and ensuring successful delivery of process automation solutions across the African region.


What's in it for you?


	Career Development- Access to tailored learning programs, mentorship opportunities, and a clear path for progression within a global organization.
	Continuous Learning - Upskill through hands-on experience, internal training platforms, and exposure to cutting-edge tools and technologies.
	Global Exposure - Collaborate with diverse teams across regions, gaining insights into international best practices and expanding your professional network.
	Meaningful Work - Be part of projects that make a real impact — from shaping talent strategies to enhancing employee experiences.
	Supportive Culture - Work in an environment that values respect, inclusion, and collaboration, where your voice is heard and your contributions are celebrated.
	Perks & Benefits - Competitive compensation, flexible working arrangements, wellness programs, and more — because your well-being matters.


 

 

2.) Service Engineer - Process Automation

Job Location: Lagos
Slot: 2 Openings
Employment Type: Full-time

About the job


	An exciting opportunity has arisen within our Process Automation (PA) business unit for a Two Service Engineer to join our delivery team, operating as part of Africa Hub.
	As a Service Engineer, you will be part of a team responsible for providing technical support, troubleshooting, and maintenance services for our Process Automation systems at critical customer sites, mostly with DCS and Safety solutions.
	This role includes both regular maintenance and brownfield projects with a wide technology spectrum. You will work closely with our clients to ensure the smooth operation and optimization of their automation systems.


What will you do?


	Perform installation, commissioning, maintenance, and troubleshooting of process automation systems (including controllers, HMI, network, and workstations).
	Conduct system testing and participate in system integration activities.
	As a team member, develop logic & HMI screens for brownfield projects and system setup in staging areas.
	Provide technical support to customers, including diagnosing and resolving system issues.
	On-duty availability, on a weekly basis, for department scheduling.
	Collaborate with clients to understand their operational needs and deliver tailored solutions.
	Conduct system upgrades and enhancements to improve operational efficiency.
	Maintain accurate records of service activities, including reports on service calls, system modifications, and customer interactions.
	Stay updated on the latest technologies and trends in process automation.


What qualifications will make you successful for this role?


	Bachelor's degree in Automation/Computer Science/Electrical field or equivalent experience.
	Proven experience in servicing and troubleshooting process automation for continuous process industries like Oil & Gas, Energy or Chemicals.
	Strong knowledge of DCSs, PLCs, SCADA systems, and industrial communication protocols.
	Previous knowledge of Foxboro, Triconex, and Modicon systems would be a plus.
	Knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating systems administration.
	Familiarity with Ethernet networks and principles of Cybersecurity.


What skills and capabilities will make you successful?:


	You need to enjoy learning new things every day. Our technology evolves, so do we.
	Problem-solving, even under time-pressure, is required.
	Ability to work both independently at site and in a team environment in office.
	Collaboration - working as a team with peers and Project Managers is key to deliver timely results.
	Technical writing for service activities, including reports, logs, and technical documentation.
	Willingness to travel to customer sites for up to 75% of the working period.


Who will you report to?:


	Reporting to: Service Manager - Sub-Saharan Africa, Process Automation
	Team Environment: Collaborative role within the Process Automation Delivery Team
	Stakeholders: Internal engineering teams, project managers, and external clients across industrial sectors
	Role Type: Individual contributor positions with high technical responsibility and client-facing engagement.


What's in it for you?


	Career Development- Access to tailored learning programs, mentorship opportunities, and a clear path for progression within a global organization.
	Continuous Learning - Upskill through hands-on experience, internal training platforms, and exposure to cutting-edge tools and technologies.
	Global Exposure - Collaborate with diverse teams across regions, gaining insights into international best practices and expanding your professional network.
	Meaningful Work - Be part of projects that make a real impact — from shaping talent strategies to enhancing employee experiences.
	Supportive Culture - Work in an environment that values respect, inclusion, and collaboration, where your voice is heard and your contributions are celebrated.
	Perks & Benefits - Competitive compensation, flexible working arrangements, wellness programs, and more — because your well-being matters.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Delivery Manager - Process Automation

Req ID: 94124
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Delivery Manager - Process Automation to lead and manage a high-performing customer project and service execution team.
	This role is responsible for overseeing the successful delivery of automation projects across various geographical scopes (local, national, regional, and global).
	The ideal candidate will ensure operational excellence, customer satisfaction, and profitability during the execution phase, while dedicating over 50% of their time to strategic and managerial responsibilities.


What will you do?
Team Leadership & Management:


	Lead, mentor, and develop a cross-functional team of project managers, engineers, and service professionals.
	Foster a high-performance culture focused on accountability, innovation, and continuous improvement.
	Allocate resources effectively across multiple projects and regions.


Project & Service Delivery:


	Oversee the end-to-end execution of customer projects and services in the process automation domain.
	Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
	Monitor and manage project risks, issues, and dependencies.


Customer Engagement:


	Serve as the primary escalation point for customer concerns during the execution phase.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure customer satisfaction and retention.
	Translate customer needs into actionable project plans and deliverables.


Performance & Profitability:


	Drive operational efficiency and profitability across all delivery engagements.
	Track and report on key performance indicators (KPIs), including financial performance, delivery timelines, and quality metrics.
	Implement best practices and standard operating procedures to optimize delivery outcomes.


Strategic Contribution:


	Collaborate with senior leadership to align delivery strategies with business goals.
	Contribute to the development of new service offerings and continuous improvement initiatives.
	Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape.


What qualifications will make you successful for this role?


	Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
	8+ years of experience in project delivery or service management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
	Proven experience in process automation, digital transformation, or industrial automation.
	Strong understanding of project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, etc.).
	Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to manage complex, multi-region projects with cross-functional teams.


What skills and capabilities will make you successful?


	PMP, PRINCE2, or similar project management certification.
	Experience with automation platforms.
	Familiarity with ITIL or service management frameworks.
	Experience working in multicultural environments.


What's in it for you?


	Career Development- Access to tailored learning programs, mentorship opportunities, and a clear path for progression within a global organization.
	Continuous Learning - Upskill through hands-on experience, internal training platforms, and exposure to cutting-edge tools and technologies.
	Global Exposure - Collaborate with diverse teams across regions, gaining insights into international best practices and expanding your professional network.
	Meaningful Work - Be part of projects that make a real impact — from shaping talent strategies to enhancing employee experiences.
	Supportive Culture - Work in an environment that values respect, inclusion, and collaboration, where your voice is heard and your contributions are celebrated.
	Perks & Benefits - Competitive compensation, flexible working arrangements, wellness programs, and more — because your well-being matters.


Who will you report to?


	Reports to Delivery Leader – Process Automation
	Internal stakeholders: Project Managers, Solution Architects, and Automation Engineers; Sales and Pre-Sales Teams; Finance, Procurement, and Legal Departments; Regional and Global Delivery Teams.
	External: Key customer stakeholders and Third-party vendors and technology partners.

Accountant Job at Eunisell Limited




        
    

        
        Eunisell Limited is a specialty chemicals and engineering solutions company, supplying key chemicals and production solutions to a wide range of customers operating in the downstream oil and gas, automotive and industrial sectors in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Roles and Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Checking daily posting of all financial transactions on ERP
	Posting of Accruals, amortization and depreciation into ERP
	Updating Fixed Asset Register, Tagging and Coding of all assets
	Monthly Stock count and verification of Fixed Assets/Equipment
	Responsible for checking the Trial Balance to ensure they are credible, complete and accurate
	Preparing Weekly Forecast
	Preparing Financial Projections and simulations (Financial Modelling)
	Responsible for checking all subsidiary ledgers and reconciling them to control account.
	Coordinating Financial and Tax Audit with External Auditors
	Preparing Monthly, Quarterly and yearly Financial Reports for review by theHead of Department
	Posting/Updating all Suppliers invoices on the system
	Prepare all bank reconciliation statements on time with accuracy
	Preparing the Budget for the department
	Managing and training staff when necessary
	Other projects/duties as assigned for the overall benefit of the organization.


Minimum Educational Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree / HND in Accounting / Finance / Business / Economics etc with 6 years of work experience.
	A Master's Degree in a relevant field is an added advantage.
	Professional membership and certification (ACA, ACCA etc) is MANDATORY.


Minimum Expectation:


	Innovation
	Accuracy
	Reliability and credibilty of reporting
	Integrity
	Professionalism
	Versatility
	Thoroughness
	Follow up skills
	Time management skills
	Analytical skills
	Reporting skills
	Team player.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and Applications to: recruitment@eunisell.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
